'Drča' is a village in the foothills of the Gorjanci Hills in the Municipality
of Šentjernej in southeastern Slovenia. The area was traditionally part of Lower
Carniola. It is now included in the Southeast Slovenia statistical
region.<ref>[http://www.sentjernej.si Šentjernej municipal site]</ref>

It is best known as the location of the Pleterje Charterhouse, a monastery
founded in 1407 with a walled enclosure that includes a Gothic church, dedicated
to the Holy Trinity and a newer part of the monastery including its library,
built between 1899 and 1904.<ref>[http://rkd.situla.org/ Slovenian Ministry of
Culture register of national heritage] reference number ešd 528</ref>
